content.raw:
Yes, it performs process management and plugin management. Here is an example usage: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/pull-requests/110/added-gamelogic-plugin/diff#chg-subt_ign/launch/competition.ign

Yes, it is one more consumer of ign-tools. 

I'm actually a big fan of "dumping" potentially unrelated functionality into components. I'd rather have seen `ign-plugin` be a component of `ign-common` than a separate repository.

Your last concern is that ign-tools hasn't changed in a while, and therefore we shouldn't change it. I'm not sure we want to base code changes and releases on time.
content.html:
Yes, it performs process management and plugin management. Here is an example usage: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/subt/pull-requests/110/added-gamelogic-plugin/diff#chg-subt_ign/launch/competition.ign

Yes, it is one more consumer of ign-tools.

I'm actually a big fan of "dumping" potentially unrelated functionality into components. I'd rather have seen ign-plugin be a component of ign-common than a separate repository.

Your last concern is that ign-tools hasn't changed in a while, and therefore we shouldn't change it. I'm not sure we want to base code changes and releases on time.
